current-chamber.#text: In the House of Representatives, U. S.,

official-title.#text: Providing for authority to initiate litigation for actions by the President or other executive branch officials inconsistent with their duties under the Constitution of the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is authorized to initiate or intervene in one or more civil actions on behalf of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in a Federal court of competent jurisdiction to seek any appropriate relief regarding the failure of the

, the head of any department or agency, or any other officer or employee of the executive branch, to act in a manner consistent with that official’s duties under the Constitution and laws of the United States with respect to implementation of any provision of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010/t:I

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including any amendment made by such provision, or any other related provision of law, including a failure to implement any such provision.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: subtitle B of title II of the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act of 2010/t:II/st:B
Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: of a decision to initiate or intervene in any civil action pursuant to this resolution.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of the General Counsel of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in any civil action initiated, or in which the
intervenes, pursuant to this resolution, and may employ the services of outside counsel and other experts for this purpose.
shall cause to be printed in the Congressional Record a statement setting forth the aggregate amounts expended by the
on outside counsel and other experts pursuant to

internal-xref.#tail: on a quarterly basis. Such statement shall be submitted for printing not more than 30 days after the expiration of each such period.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 676 EH: Providing for authority to initiate litigation for actions by the President or other executive branch officials inconsistent with their duties under the Constitution of the United States.
